Package it.polimi.ingsw.view.virtual

Class VirtualView

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.ingsw.view.virtual.VirtualView
  • public class VirtualView
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is responsible of bridging the network and model packages converting game-related request into Deliverables. On this end, Deliverables are sent to (and received from) the VirtualClient, whose VirtualClient.deliver(Deliverable) method is invoked.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private Controller controller
      The Controller that the VirtualView will forward its responses to, triggering changes in the Game status.
      private Game game
      The Game that instantiated the VirtualView.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description

      This is the only constructor.

      • getController

        public Controller getController()
        Getter method for the controller attribute.
        Returns:

      • send

        private int send​(Player recipient,
                 Deliverable deliverable)
          throws AbortedTurnException
        Sends a Deliverable to a Player's client.
        Parameters:
        recipient - The recipient of the Deliverable.
        deliverable - The Deliverable of interest.
        Returns:
        the response to the Deliverable.
        Throws:
        AbortedTurnException - When the request routine catches a ConnectionException and the current turn needs to be ended prematurely.

      • broadcast

        private void broadcast​(Deliverable deliverable)
        Sends a Deliverable to all Players connected to the game
        Parameters:
        deliverable - the Deliverable to broadcast.

                 throws AbortedTurnException

      • spawn

        public void spawn​(Player subject)
           throws AbortedTurnException
        Initiates the spawning routine for a player.
        Parameters:
        subject - the player.
        Throws:
        AbortedTurnException - when the player loses connection. This will prematurely end, and skip, the player's turn.

                                 java.util.List<Execution> executions)
                          throws AbortedTurnException
        Queries the Player about which Execution they intend to use for their turn.
        Parameters:
        subject - the current player.
        executions - a list containing all the possible Executions.
        Returns:
        the chosen Execution.
        Throws:
        AbortedTurnException - when the player loses connection. This will prematurely end, and skip, the player's turn.

        Parameters:

        cells - the list of possible Cells to legally move to.
        Throws:
        AbortedTurnException - when the player loses connection. This will prematurely end, and skip, the player's turn.

      • shootAttackModule

        public void shootAttackModule​(Player subject,
                              AttackPattern pattern,
                              java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> next)
                       throws AbortedTurnException
        Queries a Player about which AttackModule they intend to use to perform a Shoot.
        Parameters:
        subject - the attacker.
        pattern - the AttackPattern of the previously chosen Weapon.
        next - a list containing the numerical ids of the available AttackModules inside the AttackPattern.
        Throws:
        AbortedTurnException - when the player loses connection. This will prematurely end, and skip, the player's turn.

      • acquireTargets

        public void acquireTargets​(Player subject,
                           AttackModule attackModule,
                           java.util.List<Target> targets)
                    throws AbortedTurnException
        Initiates the Target acquisition sequence.
        Parameters:
        subject - the attacker, also the player being queried.
        attackModule - the attack being brought forward by the subject.
        targets - a list of all the Targets that need to be acquired in order to discharge the attack.
        Throws:
        AbortedTurnException - when the player loses connection. This will prematurely end, and skip, the player's turn.

      • shootPlayer

        private Player shootPlayer​(Player subject,
                           TargetPlayer target)
                    throws NoValidTargetsException,
                           AbortedTurnException
        Queries a Player on which opponent they intend to use as a Target.
        Parameters:
        subject - the player to query.
        target - the Target containing the Constraints defining which choices are legal.
        Returns:
        the index of the targeted Player.
        Throws:
        NoValidTargetsException - when the list of legal choices is empty, making it impossible to query the player.
        AbortedTurnException - when the player loses connection. This will prematurely end, and skip, the player's turn.

      • shootCell

                       TargetCell target)
                throws NoValidTargetsException,
                       AbortedTurnException
        Queries a Player on which Cell they intend to use as a Target.
        Parameters:

        target - the Target containing the Constraints defining which choices are legal.

        Throws:

        AbortedTurnException - when the player loses connection. This will prematurely end, and skip, the player's turn.

      • scope

        public void scope​(Damage damage,
                  java.util.List<Player> targets)
           throws AbortedTurnException
        Starts a request routine about the usage of a Teleport PowerUp.
        Parameters:
        damage - the effect taking place. The Player found as author of it will be queried.
        targets - the victims to the damage effect, since only damaged players can be attacked with a Scope.
        Throws:
        AbortedTurnException - when the player loses connection. This will prematurely end, and skip, the player's turn.

      • grenade

        public void grenade​(Player subject,
                    Player originalAttacker)
             throws AbortedTurnException
        Starts a request routine about the usage of a Grenade PowerUp.
        Parameters:
        subject - the player to query.
        originalAttacker - the player from which subject was attacked.
        Throws:
        AbortedTurnException - when the player loses connection. This will prematurely end, and skip, the player's turn.

        subject - the player to query.
        Throws:
        AbortedTurnException - when the player loses connection. This will prematurely end, and skip, the player's turn.

      • announceTurn

        public void announceTurn​(Player subject)
        Announces when the turn passes from a Player onto another.
        Parameters:
        subject - the player who just began their turn.

      • announceDamage

        public void announceDamage​(Player author,
                           Player target,
                           int amount)
        Announces when a Player takes Damage.
        Parameters:
        author - The source of the damage.
        target - The victim.
        amount - The amount of damage.

      • announceMarking

        public void announceMarking​(Player author,
                            Player target,
                            int amount)
        Announces when a Player is Marked.
        Parameters:
        author - The source of the mark.
        target - The victim.
        amount - The number of marks.

      • announceMove

        public void announceMove​(Player author,
                         Player target,
                         Cell destination)
        Announces when a Player moves either themselves or an opponent.
        Parameters:
        author - the player who decided the destination.
        target - the player being moved,
        destination - the destination.

      • announceKill

        public void announceKill​(Player author,
                         Player target)
        Announces when a Player is killed.
        Parameters:
        author - The killer.
        target - The victim.

      • announceScore

        public void announceScore​(Player source,
                          Player creditor,
                          int amount,
                          boolean firstBloodOrDoubleKill)
        Announces when a Player gains points.
        Parameters:
        source - The player who yielded points.
        creditor - The player who earned points.
        amount - The amount of points.
        firstBloodOrDoubleKill - Whether or not it's extra points either from a first blood or a double kill.

      • announceFrenzy

        public void announceFrenzy​(Player cause)
        Announces when a Player's death enables the Final Frenzy for the first time in the Game.
        Parameters:
        cause - the dead player's murderer.

      • announceWinner

        public void announceWinner​(java.util.List<Player> ranking)
        Broadcasts the final standings of the Game, ranking Players best to last, in decreasing order of their score.
        Parameters:
        ranking - the already sorted list of players.

      • announceDisconnect

        public void announceDisconnect​(Player disconnectedPlayer)
        Broadcasts about a Player's disconnection. This warns other players in the same Game that the disconnected player's turn will be prematurely ended and skipped.
        Parameters:
        disconnectedPlayer - the Player who lost connection.

      • announceInsufficientPlayers

        public void announceInsufficientPlayers()
        Broadcasts about an excessive number of Player disconnection. This warns other players in the same Game that the game will be prematurely ended.
